content.body: I’m sure this is excessively pedantic, but `compare(x, y) === 0` isn’t _always_ equivalent to `equals(x, y)` for inequal `x` and `y` that are of the same equivalence class (“rank”). So, apart from performance, another good reason for a separate `equals` is just a good precedent to set.
